result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant William Robert Sims IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Robert Sims IV is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Robert Sims IV was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Counts 3 - 5.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 11, 2016.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of DJOC and Probation as the Court defines it. 

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to set up a payment plan commencing October 1, 2016 through the Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with B. Killion/Sellers or T. Haugland.
-Random and regular testing.
-Participatein any treatment recommended by Agent.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to maintain treatment and/or employment.
-Diversion Coordinator to provide quarterly updates to the Court.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  William Robert Sims appeared. Case called at 1:19  Includes 15CF333, 15CF480, 15CF252, 14CM382, 14CM362, 14TR3464. ADA Minser updates the court. Atty. Repka responds and requests expungement upon successful completion of DJOC. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct. 1 felony bail jumping and G to Ct. 2 misdemeanor bail jumping as amended in the Information in 15CF333. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 witholding the entry of conviction in favor of the DJOC and 2 in 15CF333. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct. 3, 4, 5  in 15CF333 15CF252 and 15CF480. Sentencing arguments. DE has completed 1 year of treatment at the Salvation Army. Crt orders: On Ct. 2 Sentence W/H
1 year probation with conditions:
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE is to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, B. Killian/Sellers, T. Haugland.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Random and regular testing. 
- Participate in any treatment recommended by the agent. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- DE to maintain treatment and or employment. 
- All money on file to be forfeited. 

Diversion Court Coordinator to provide quarterly updates the the Court.      
DE to report to probation today. Court has no objection to probation being transferred to MN. 
Court sets $25 payment plan to commence Oct. 1. 
If DE is elligible for expungement, Court will expunge upon successful completion of probation as the court defines it.
filed by ADA E. Minser. gme
Status conference on July 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser  with student intern Tim Filipa DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka DF: William Robert Sims appeared from jail. Case called at 2:34. Includes 15CF333 (PH) and 15CF480 (PH), 15CF252 (STC) and 14CM382 (STC), 14CM362 (PayH) and 14TR3464 (PayH)  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. . Atty. Repka updates the court, DE would like to waive.  Court orders State to provide discovery. Bonds continue. All other cases to trail.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka DF: William Robert Sims appeared from jail.  Case called at 8:12.  Includes 14CM362 (PayH), 14TR3464 (PayH), 15CF252, 15CF333 and 15CF480. Court reviews files. DE has a Warrant out of Scott County MN, Polk County WI and the City of New Richmond. Atty. Repka updates the court. ADA Hartung responds. Court orders State to process the extradition and have it available for intake Friday or Mon.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Includes 15CF252, 15CF333, 15CF480.

BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S: Heather Arney 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

 It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, B. Sellers, T. Haugland.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.  __ SIGNATURE
Bail/bond hearing on May 26, 2016 at 08:00 am.
